intro: Keraselma leptophyllum, commonly known as the slender-leaved keraselma, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound umbel inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lanceolate and have a distinctive, finely divided structure, while its small white or pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and naturalized areas.
